properties.name: Hwy15
properties.desc:
Interstate Highway 15 and Cajon Pass [about 1/2 mile N of the PCT] is a busy interstate highway intersection with a McDonald's restaurant, pay phone, gas station mini-mart and a hiker-friendly Best Western Motel [760-249-6777].
---
WATER ALERT: Next northbound water after Cajon Pass may be Guffy Spring in 22.3 miles. This can be a very long, hot, steep, waterless climb.

properties.name: RR0343
properties.desc: Tunnel under a railroad track, shade.

properties.name: RD0344B
properties.desc: Unpaved road near a high voltage power line.

properties.name: RD0344C
properties.desc: PCT joins an unpaved road along a high voltage power line.

properties.name: RD0344D
properties.desc: PCT departs the unpaved road and crosses under a power line.

properties.name: CS0362
properties.desc: Campsite near the end of an unpaved road.

properties.name: BaldyTrail
properties.desc: Trail to Mount Baldy [AKA Mount San Antonio], 200 feet SW of PCT.

properties.name: MtBaldy
properties.desc: Mount Baldy [AKA Mount San Antonio], 10,063 feet, 3.9 miles S of PCT.

properties.name: Memorial0363
properties.desc: 1983 winter transit memorial stone, at the base of two "V" trees facing away from the trail. Jodi Zaitchick and Jerry Duran died in a December 1983 fall 363 miles into the first known PCT winter thru-hike attempt.

properties.name: TR0363
properties.desc: Acorn trail junction to Wrightwood [3.6 miles, dropping 2,337 feet]. It's probably better for most hikers to go 6 miles N on the PCT to Hwy 2 and hitch 5.5 miles E to Wrightwood on Hwy 2.

properties.name: WR0364
properties.desc:
Guffy Spring, 1/10 mile N of the PCT. Follow use trail about 1/10 mile before campground]
---
WATER ALERT: Next water southbound after Guffy Spring may be Cajon Pass in 22.3 miles.

properties.name: Hwy2
properties.desc: Inspiration Point trailhead parking, 1st crossing of Hwy 2, outhouse, trash can, paved parking area. Access to the town of Wrightwood.

properties.name: WR0370
properties.desc: Grassy Hollow Visitor Center, water spigot.

properties.name: RD0371
properties.desc: PCT joins a narrow paved road.

properties.name: RD0371B
properties.desc: PCT departs the narrow paved road.

properties.name: DoorCanyonCrk
properties.desc: Door Canyon Creek, wide rocky creek bed.

properties.name: SouthForkCG
properties.desc: South Fork Campground, outhouse, water from creek - detour mile 5.3.

properties.name: Hwy2B
properties.desc: Vincent Gap, 2nd crossing of Hwy 2, outhouse, trash cans, picnic table, large paved parking area, used by Mt Baden Powell day hikers.

properties.name: WR0376
properties.desc: Lamel Spring, 425 ft S of PCT mile 375.9.

properties.name: TR0378
properties.desc: Mount Baden Powell spur trail junction.

properties.name: MtBadenPowell
properties.desc: Mount Baden Powell, 9399 feet, 1/10 mile S of PCT.

properties.name: TR0384
properties.desc: Windy Gap, trail junction to Crystal Lake, Mount Islip.

properties.name: TR0384B
properties.desc: Trail junction to Little Jimmy Spring.

properties.name: TR0384C
properties.desc: Another trail junction to Little Jimmy Spring.

properties.name: CS0384
properties.desc: Little Jimmy Campground. The PCT goes right at the unsigned trail just before the campground.

properties.name: Hwy2C
properties.desc: Islip Saddle, 3rd crossing of Hwy 2, outhouse, trash can, paved trailhead parking, start of the official endangered species detour.

properties.name: BigRockCrk
properties.desc: South Fork of Big Rock Creek - detour mile 5.

properties.name: BigRockCrk2
properties.desc: South Fork Big Rock Creek, 2nd crossing - detour mile 5.5.

properties.name: DevilsChairTr
properties.desc: Devils Chair trail junction - detour mile 8.2.

properties.name: HolcombCynCrk
properties.desc: Holcomb Canyon Creek, water, campsite - detour mile 7.7.

properties.name: LittleRockTrib
properties.desc: Tributary of Little Rock Creek - detour mile 19.

properties.name: PunchBowlPark
properties.desc: Devils Punchbowl County Park with water fountain, out house, trash can, but no camping, park closes at sunset - 9/10 mile SW of detour mile 10.8.

properties.name: PunchbowlPrkTr
properties.desc: Trail to Devils Punchbowl County Park [park is 9/10 mile SE of detour] - detour mile 10.8.

properties.name: BuckhornCG
properties.desc: Buckhorn Flat Campground, 2 miles S of PCT [on Endangered Species Detour].

properties.name: BurkhartTH
properties.desc: Burkhart trailhead, paved parkign area, outhouse.

properties.name: EaglesRoost
properties.desc:
Eagles Roost Picnic Area, outhouse, picnic tables, trash cans, paved parking area. Endangered species bypass.
---
The once thriving Mountain Yellow-Legged Frog is now nearly extinct. To protect the frog, the PCT is closed for 2.7 miles from Eagles Roost to the Burkhart Trail junction. Hikers can bypass the closure by road walking 2.7 miles along Hwy 2 to Buckhorn Campground, then follow the campground road and Burkhart Trail 2.2 miles to rejoin the PCT.

properties.name: WA0390
properties.desc: Seasonal spring 7/10 mile S of PCT.

properties.name: WRCS0395
properties.desc: Cooper Canyon Trail Camp, seasonal creek nearby.

properties.name: WR0401
properties.desc: Camp Glenwood, Boy Scout Camp, outhouse, picnic table, possible water tank.

properties.name: RD0401
properties.desc: PCT departs the unpaved road to Camp Glenwood.

properties.name: Hwy2H
properties.desc: 8th crossing of Hwy 2, outhouse, parking, trash can nearby.

properties.name: RD0403
properties.desc: PCT departs the abandoned road bed.

properties.name: Hwy2I
properties.desc: Three Points Trailhead, 9th crossing of Hwy 2, outhouse, picnic tables, trash cans, paved parking.

properties.name: TR0407
properties.desc: Trail junction with equestrian PCT alternate.

properties.name: WR0407
properties.desc: Sulphur Spring, 1/10 mile E of PCT.

properties.name: WR0419
properties.desc:
Mill Creek Fire Station, water spigot, trail register.
---
WATER ALERT: Next northbound water after Mill Creek Fire Station may be the North Fork Ranger Station in 17.5 miles.

properties.name: WR0436
properties.desc:
Paved road to the North Fork Ranger Station.
---
WATER ALERT: Next southbound water after North Fork Ranger Station may be the Mill Creek Ranger Station in 17.5 miles.

properties.name: TH0444
properties.desc: Indian Canyon Trailhead near Soledad Canyon Road, parking, outhouse, picnic table, trash can.

properties.name: RD0444
properties.desc: Paved Soledad Canyon Road, Indian Canyon Trailhead, paved parking, outhouse, trash can. Access to the community of Acton, 6.5 miles E on Soledad Canyon Road.

properties.name: ActonKOA
properties.desc: Acton KOA RV park [koa.com/campgrounds/acton/, 661-268-1214], 2/10 mile E of PCT with camping, showers, laundry, and a small store. To reach the KOA cross Soledad Canyon Rd and walk N on the PCT down the embankment. Look to the right and you will see the KOA campground across the flat open area. If you cross the creek you have gone too far.

properties.name: TR0444
properties.desc: Use trail to the Acton KOA RV park, 2/10 mile E of PCT.

properties.name: GoldenSpike
properties.desc: A small monument near a railroad track where the Pacific Crest Trail was officially declared complete in a "Golden Spike" ceremony on June 5th 1993.

properties.name: AguaDulce
properties.desc: Agua Dulce is a small town on the PCT with a good grocery store, restaurants, pay phones, ATM and Hiker Heaven [AKA the Saufley's, hikerheaven.com, 661-268-1235, guest [hiker] phone 661-402-5000]. Hiker Heaven is usually open March - June and in the fall for southbounders. The PCT follows the road through the center of Agua Dulce. To reach Hiker Heaven walk past the grocery store and pizza place and turn left on Darling Road for 1 mile.
